intro: Anomostephium ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf anomostephium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, this plant is adapted to survive in dry environments. It typically grows from a basal rosette of leaves, with flowering stems emerging from the center. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
